meta_description: The Brooklyn Museum is one of the oldest, largest, and boldest museums in the United States.

# Monet and Venice

October 11, 2025–February 1, 2026

[Public tickets __](https://secure.brooklynmuseum.org/13824)[Member tickets __](https://secure.brooklynmuseum.org/13825)

Overview

Artists and artworks

Read all about it

Shop this exhibition

Enjoy Venice at night—and experience this must-see exhibition before it closes! _Monet and Venice_ will remain open until 8 pm on Saturday, January 31, and Sunday, February 1. The last entry to the exhibition __ is at 6:45 pm. General admission galleries close at 6 pm. [Get tickets now.​  __](https://secure.brooklynmuseum.org/13824)

Claude Monet once claimed that Venice was “too beautiful to be painted,” a challenge he embraced by creating an extraordinary sequence of works depicting the Italian city. _Monet and Venice_ is the first exhibition to focus on Monet’s luminous Venetian paintings—a radiant yet underexplored chapter in the artist’s late career—since their debut in 1912. 

New York’s largest museum show dedicated to Monet in over 25 years, the exhibition features more than 100 artworks, books, and ephemera. Two masterpieces, the Brooklyn Museum’s own _Palazzo Ducale_ and _The Grand Canal, Venice_ from the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco, are presented alongside selections from throughout Monet’s career—including 19 of his Venetian paintings.
